intro: Crotalaria sapinii, commonly known as the sand crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange and are clustered in racemes, while the leaves are pinnately compound. Crotalaria sapinii is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
